info.description:
The main API structure

- `/api/v1beta/` <- Most of the API is nested under here. All of the resources there are scoped to what is accessible by the authenticated identity.
- `/api/v1beta/me` <- Everything under this path is scoped to the subject of the authenticated identity.
This means that the identity may be authorized to view more resources, but this is the default view for them.
E.g. the chats route scoped under there will only list the chats created by the user, but the user may be authorized to also view chats shared by other users.

get.summary: List all assistants available to the user

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided
When no valid JWT token is provided

get.summary: Get a specific assistant with its files

parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assistant to retrieve

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

404.description: Assistant not found or access denied

parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assistant to update

400.description: Invalid assistant ID format or request data

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

404.description: Assistant not found or access denied

parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assistant to archive

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

404.description: Assistant not found or access denied

post.description:
This endpoint marks a chat as archived by setting its archived_at timestamp.
Archived chats can be filtered out from the recent chats listing by default.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to archive

401.description: User not authorized to archive this chat

get.summary: Get all messages for a specific chat

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to get messages for

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return per page. Defaults to 100 if not provided. Larger values may impact performance.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of messages to skip for pagination. Defaults to 0 if not provided.

200.description: Successfully retrieved messages with pagination metadata

get.summary: Get a single file by its ID
get.description: This endpoint retrieves information about a specific file by its ID.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file to retrieve

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

404.description: When the file doesn't exist or doesn't belong to the user

get.summary: Get all drives accessible to the user.
get.description:
This includes:
- The user's personal OneDrive
- Drives shared with the user
- Recent items (as a pseudo-drive)

401.description: No access token available

get.summary: Get the root items of a specific drive.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive

200.description: List of items in the drive root

401.description: No access token available

404.description: Drive not found or Sharepoint integration is not enabled

get.summary: Get details of a specific drive item.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the item

401.description: No access token available

404.description: Item not found or Sharepoint integration is not enabled

get.summary: Get the children of a folder in a drive.

parameters.name: drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the drive

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder

200.description: List of items in the folder

401.description: No access token available

404.description: Folder not found or Sharepoint integration is not enabled

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

500.description: When an internal server error occurs

post.summary: Create a new chat without an initial message
post.description:
This endpoint allows creating a new chat without requiring an initial message.
This is useful for scenarios where you want to upload files before sending the first message.

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

post.summary: Upload files and return UUIDs for each
post.description:
This endpoint accepts a multipart form with one or more files and returns UUIDs for each.
If chat_id is provided, files are associated with that chat. If not provided, files are created
as standalone uploads that can be linked to assistants later.

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: Optional chat ID to associate the file with. If not provided, creates standalone files.

post.summary: Link an external file (SharePoint, Google Drive, etc.) and return a file upload record
post.description:
This endpoint creates a file upload record that references an external file,
allowing it to be used in chat messages or attached to assistants.
If chat_id is provided, the file is associated with that chat. If not provided,
the file is created as a standalone upload.

401.description: No access token available for external provider

404.description: File not found or integration not enabled

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of assistants to return. Defaults to 10 if not provided.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days to look back for usage statistics. Defaults to 30 if not provided.

400.description: When validation fails (e.g., invalid message role)

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

500.description: When an internal server error occurs

400.description: When validation fails (e.g., invalid message role)

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

500.description: When an internal server error occurs

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

404.description: No active generation task found for this chat

500.description: When an internal server error occurs

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

500.description: When an internal server error occurs

get.summary: Get available chat models for the user
get.description:
This endpoint returns all available chat models (providers) that the user can use.
Each model includes the provider ID and display name.

401.description: When no valid JWT token is provided

get.summary: List all groups in the organization.
get.description:
If the Entra ID integration is not enabled, returns an empty list.
If enabled, fetches all groups from the MS Graph API with full pagination.

401.description: No access token available

get.summary: List all users in the organization.
get.description:
If the Entra ID integration is not enabled, returns an empty list.
If enabled, fetches all users from the MS Graph API with full pagination.

401.description: No access token available
When no valid JWT token is provided

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of chats to return per page. Defaults to 30 if not provided. Larger values may impact performance.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of chats to skip for pagination. Defaults to 0 if not provided.

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived chats in results. Defaults to false if not provided.

200.description: Successfully retrieved chats with pagination metadata

LinkFileRequest.description: Request to link an external file (SharePoint, Google Drive, etc.)

chat_id.description: Optional chat ID to associate the file with. If not provided, creates standalone files.

provider_metadata.description: Provider-specific metadata (e.g., drive_id, item_id for SharePoint)

assistant_id.description:
Optional assistant ID to associate with the chat when creating a new chat.
If provided with an existing_chat_id, this field is ignored.

chat_provider_id.description: The ID of the chat provider to use for generation. If not provided, will use the highest priority model for the user.

existing_chat_id.description:
The ID of an existing chat to use. If provided, the chat with this ID will be used instead of creating a new one.
This is useful for scenarios where you have created a chat first (e.g. for file uploads) before sending the first message.

input_files_ids.description:
The IDs of any files attached to this message. These files must already be uploaded to the file_uploads table.
The files should normally only be provided with the first message they appear in the chat. After that they can assumed to be part of the chat history.

previous_message_id.description: The ID of the message that this message is a response to. If this is the first message in the chat, this should be empty.

allOf.description: May optionally be sent at the start of the stream to indicate that a new chat has been created.

oneOf.description: May optionally be sent at the start of the stream to indicate that a new chat has been created.

allOf.description: Sent at the start of the stream to indicate that the user's message has been saved.

oneOf.description: Sent at the start of the stream to indicate that the user's message has been saved.

allOf.description: Sent when the assistant message entry has been created, before generation starts.

oneOf.description: Sent when the assistant message entry has been created, before generation starts.

allOf.description: Sent when the assistant's response has been saved in full.

oneOf.description: Sent when the assistant's response has been saved in full.

allOf.description: Sent whenever a new text chunk is generated by the assistant.

oneOf.description: Sent whenever a new text chunk is generated by the assistant.

allOf.description: Sent when the LLM proposes a tool call to be part of the assistant message.

oneOf.description: Sent when the LLM proposes a tool call to be part of the assistant message.

allOf.description: Sent to update the status of a tool call execution by the backend.

oneOf.description: Sent to update the status of a tool call execution by the backend.

id.description: The unique ID of the group

subject_type_id.description: The subject type ID to use when creating a share grant (always "organization_group_id")

Whether the current user can edit this chat (e.g., edit messages)

NOTE: Currently this is true only for the chat owner. In the future,

title_by_summary.description: Title of the chat, as generated by a summary of the chat.

has_more.description: Whether there are more chats available

returned_count.description: Number of chats in the current response

chat_provider_id.description: The ID of the chat provider to use for generation. If not provided, will use the highest priority model for the user.

current_message_id.description: The ID of the message that should have a replacement response generated.

allOf.description: Sent when the assistant message entry has been created, before generation starts.

oneOf.description: Sent when the assistant message entry has been created, before generation starts.

allOf.description: Sent when the assistant's response has been saved in full.

oneOf.description: Sent when the assistant's response has been saved in full.

oneOf.description: Sent whenever a new text chunk is generated by the assistant.

oneOf.description: Sent when the LLM proposes a tool call to be part of the assistant message.

allOf.description: Sent to update the status of a tool call execution by the backend.

oneOf.description: Sent to update the status of a tool call execution by the backend.

chat_id.description: The ID of the chat to resume streaming for.

created_at.description: When this share grant was created

id.description: The unique ID of the share grant

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource being shared

resource_type.description: The type of resource being shared (e.g., "assistant")

subject_id.description: The ID of the subject being granted access

subject_id_type.description: The type of subject ID (e.g., "id" or "oidc_issuer_and_subject")

subject_type.description: The type of subject being granted access (e.g., "user")

updated_at.description: When this share grant was last updated

ShareGrantInput.description: A share grant to create with the assistant

subject_id.description: The ID of the subject to grant access to

subject_id_type.description: The type of subject ID (e.g., "id" or "oidc_issuer_and_subject")

subject_type.description: The type of subject to grant access to (e.g., "user")

drive_id.description: The ID of the drive containing the file

item_id.description: The ID of the file item

chat_provider_id.description: Optional chat provider ID to use for token estimation. If not provided, uses the default provider.

existing_chat_id.description: The ID of an existing chat to use. If provided, the chat with this ID will be used instead of creating a new one.

input_files_ids.description: The IDs of any files attached to this message. These files must already be uploaded to the file_uploads table.

previous_message_id.description: The ID of the message that this message is a response to. If this is the first message in the chat, this should be empty.

file_details.description: Detailed token usage for each file

TokenUsageResponseFileItem.description: Token usage details for an individual file

filename.description: The original filename of the file

id.description: The unique ID of the file

token_count.description: Number of tokens used for this file's content

TokenUsageStats.description: Token usage statistics for the request

chat_provider_id.description: The chat provider ID that was used for this estimation

file_tokens.description: Number of tokens in file contents

history_tokens.description: Number of tokens in previous messages (chat history)

max_tokens.description: The configured model's maximum token limit

remaining_tokens.description: Remaining tokens available for the model response

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens in the request

user_message_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the user message

UpdateAssistantRequest.description: Request to update an existing assistant

description.description: Optional new description for the assistant

file_ids.description: Optional list of file upload IDs to associate with this assistant

mcp_server_ids.description: Optional new list of MCP server IDs

name.description: Optional new name for the assistant

prompt.description: Optional new prompt for the assistant

allOf.description: The updated assistant with files

email.description: The user's email address. Shouldn't be used as a unique identifier, as it may change.

groups.description:
List of groups the user belongs to.

This is derived from the `groups` claim in the ID token.
If the claim is not present, this will be an empty list.

organization_group_ids.description:
Organization group IDs from the `groups` claim.

These can be used as subject_id when creating share grants
with subject_id_type "organization_group_id".

organization_user_id.description:
Organization user ID from the `oid` claim (Entra ID specific).

This can be used as the subject_id when creating share grants
with subject_id_type "organization_user_id".

preferred_language.description:
The user's preferred language.

The final determined language is intersected with our supported languages, to determine the final language.

Will be a BCP 47 language tag (e.g. "en" or "en-US").

This is derived in the following order (highest priority first):
- ID token claims
- Browser Accept-Language header
- Default to "en"
